I see warnings above whenever i use backup.bat. Would this error affect the pushed data? I want this error message to be solved fundametally without harming any data when git push or pull is done.

That's a very common and safe warning, but it's good practice to resolve it for consistency. No, this warning will **not** affect or corrupt your pushed data.

It happens because your Windows system uses a different line ending character (CRLF) than the one Git prefers for its internal storage (LF), which is the standard for Linux and macOS. The warning is just Git telling you that it will automatically convert the line endings to be consistent when you commit.

The fundamental way to solve this is to tell Git how to handle line endings for your project. This is done by creating a `.gitattributes` file. This file will ensure that all developers, regardless of their operating system, use consistent line endings.

I will now create a standard `.gitattributes` file in your project's root directory. This is a one-time setup that will solve this issue permanently without any risk to your data.

My current approach involves either removing this `marginLeft` entirely or finding an alternative positioning strategy.
